item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3713">teknix</a>.
You could always use a traditional PuSH hub. PuSHPress is tied closely to WordPress itself, with no intention of being a stand alone service.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to teknix.

You could always use a traditional PuSH hub. PuSHPress is tied closely to WordPress itself, with no intention of being a stand alone service.

item.title: By: teknix
item.dc:creator: teknix
item.description:
Hello Joseph!
First off, great work! nice to see a complete php implementation of PuSH!
I am curious though, what would it take to make it non-reliant on Wordpress? I am currently working on an fail2ban sync tool and would like to implement this without the additional weight of wordpress.
thank you for your time :)
item.content:encoded:
Hello Joseph!

First off, great work! nice to see a complete php implementation of PuSH!

I am curious though, what would it take to make it non-reliant on WordPress?
I am currently working on an fail2ban sync tool and would like to implement this without the additional weight of wordpress.

thank you for your time ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: legolasthehansy
item.dc:creator: legolasthehansy
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3711">Joseph Scott</a>.
Thanks Joseph. Really appreciate your replies. Your plugin does work on Reader now. :-) Thank you again.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Thanks Joseph. Really appreciate your replies. Your plugin does work on Reader now. ðŸ™‚ Thank you again.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3710">legolasthehansy</a>.
Enabling PuSH on your site doesn't force Google Reader to actually use it. It is up to their system to subscribe to updates and do something with them.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to legolasthehansy.

Enabling PuSH on your site doesn’t force Google Reader to actually use it. It is up to their system to subscribe to updates and do something with them.

item.title: By: legolasthehansy
item.dc:creator: legolasthehansy
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3709">Joseph Scott</a>.
Thank you for your reply. This is my site www.pulivila.com and my feed has tag but I don't see real-time updates on Google Reader. I was wondering (even though there aren't any additional steps mentioned anywhere), if I needed to do something extra to make your plugin work on my site.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

Thank you for your reply. This is my site http://www.pulivila.com/ and my feed has tag but I don’t see real-time updates on Google Reader. I was wondering (even though there aren’t any additional steps mentioned anywhere), if I needed to do something extra to make your plugin work on my site.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3708">legolasthehansy</a>.
Nothing else, just install and activate the plugin.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to legolasthehansy.

Nothing else, just install and activate the plugin.

item.title: By: legolasthehansy
item.dc:creator: legolasthehansy
item.description: Hi Joseph, Is there any other steps involved other than the 3 step install process for pushpress? Download, install and activate.. Are there any ports to be opened? Any minor changes to be made on some files? I have set this up for our blog and haven't got it to work yet.. :-I
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joseph,
Is there any other steps involved other than the 3 step install process for pushpress? Download, install and activate.. Are there any ports to be opened? Any minor changes to be made on some files? I have set this up for our blog and haven’t got it to work yet.. :-I

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2011/05/27/pushpress-0-1-7/#comment-3705">VBK</a>.
As you listed in your original comment the plugin has been tested and is compatible up through WordPress version 3.2. So there is no problem using it with version 3.0.3 (though I recommend upgrading your WordPress install).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to VBK.

As you listed in your original comment the plugin has been tested and is compatible up through WordPress version 3.2. So there is no problem using it with version 3.0.3 (though I recommend upgrading your WordPress install).
